flixel.util.FlxTimer

type
class
A simple timer class, leveraging the new plugins system. Can be used with callbacks or by polling the finished flag. Not intended to be added to a game state or group; the timer manager is responsible for actually calling update(), not the user.

Static Variables

manager : flixel.plugin.TimerManager

Read-only: The TimerManager instance.

Static Methods

put(timer : FlxTimer) : Void

recycle() : FlxTimer

Returns a recycled timer.

start(?Time : Float, ?Callback : FlxTimer -> Void, ?Loops : Int) : FlxTimer

parameters
Time How many seconds it takes for the timer to go off.
Callback Optional, triggered whenever the time runs out, once for each loop. Callback should be formed "onTimer(Timer:FlxTimer);"
Loops How many times the timer should go off. Default is 1, or "just count down once."
Returns a recycled timer and starts it.

Constructor

new()
Internal constructor. This is private, use recycle() or start() to get timers instead.

Instance Variables

elapsedLoops(accessor,null) : Int

Read-only: how many loops that have elapsed since the timer was started.

elapsedTime(accessor,null) : Float

Read-only: The amount of milliseconds that have elapsed since the timer was started

finished : Bool

Check to see if the timer is finished.

loops : Int

How many loops the timer was set for.

loopsLeft(accessor,null) : Int

Read-only: check how many loops are left on the timer.

paused : Bool

Pauses or checks the pause state of the timer.

progress(accessor,null) : Float

Read-only: how far along the timer is, on a scale of 0.0 to 1.0.

time : Float

How much time the timer was set for.

timeLeft(accessor,null) : Float

Read-only: check how much time is left on the timer.

usePooling : Bool

Whether to reset and put this FlxTimer object into internal timers pool automatically after it finishes it's work.

userData : Dynamic

Useful to store values you want to access within your callback function, ex: FlxTimer.start(1, function(t) { trace(t.userData); } ).userData = "Hello World!";

Instance Methods

abort() : Void

Stops the timer and removes it from the timer manager.

destroy() : Void

Clean up memory.

reset(?NewTime : Float) : FlxTimer

parameters
NewDuration The duration of this timer in ms.
Restart the timer using the new duration

run(?Time : Float, ?Callback : FlxTimer -> Void, ?Loops : Int) : Void

parameters
Time How many seconds it takes for the timer to go off.
Callback Optional, triggered whenever the time runs out, once for each loop. Callback should be formed "onTimer(Timer:FlxTimer);"
Loops How many times the timer should go off. Default is 1, or "just count down once."
returns
A reference to itself (handy for chaining or whatever).
Starts the timer and adds the timer to the timer manager.

update() : Void

Called by the timer manager plugin to update the timer. If time runs out, the loop counter is advanced, the timer reset, and the callback called if it exists. If the timer runs out of loops, then the timer calls stop(). However, callbacks are called AFTER stop() is called.
